reviewText: So I bought these headphones because I read a review of them on cnet.com's list of low cost headphones that are big hits.  I have to say I am impressed.These have really great sound!  I got these to use in place of some noise canceling headphones I have from Sony as they hurt my head after a while, and these are really great!  They sound very rich, and they are incredibly compact and easy to throw in a bag and take with you.  That being said, I think they could get pretty tangled up easily, so I am careful to not put them anywhere without wrapping them neatly first.  But if that doesn't bother you, these headphones are an incredible, rumbly bassy bang for your buck.

reviewText: I bought two pair for my kids.  They both think they are comfortable and sound good, but my son has complained that the insulation on the wires is maybe not thick enough.  He says when the wire rubs against his clothes, it somehow transmits sound associated with that rubbing into the headphones.  I don't know if it's the static generated by the plastic rubbing against his close or the actual sound of the two materials rubbing together but he sometimes finds it distracting enough that he mentioned it to me.  Otherwise they like them and I think they are a good value for the money even with the previously mentioned flaw.

reviewText: The dog chewed up a pair of my headphones, so I was looking to replace them. I have previously ordered headphones from another 3rd party seller, but saw that these were a good price and available on Prime. I needed something quick, as I was about to go on vacation, so I decided to take a shot at these.After plugging them in and using them, I was blown away by the quality. I have bought several pairs of Skullcandy for a much higher price in the past, and the build and sound quality of these is far superior. I had no issues with the comfort of these headphones, or any issues with them falling out. Also included with these headphones are extra rubber ear pieces. If you are looking for headphones for a good price and sound, look no further, buy these.
summary: Cheap price, but has great sound quality

reviewText: Not terrible for the price but I will agree that that the bass is lacking, basically just a high tremble.  I didn't realize it but I had a pair of these before that I found at a store a year or so ago.  They still work so I can't complain, other headphones I had lasted for only a few months before they stopped working.  So I will give the product some points for "going strong."If your not too picky about sound quality than these are perfect for the price.  They have three different sized "buds" so you can choose the right size for your ear.  I have to use the large size even though I have small ears to get good sound quality.  However they do bother the inside of my ears due to the way they are designed, as the plastic seems to rest on the outer walls of my ear.

reviewText: I can honestly say, You can't go wrong with these in the sub $10 category of in-earphones. Sony quit making the ones I liked and I wanted something to go with my new blue Sandisk Sansa Cip+. Yes they are cheap but the sound is amazing for what you pay for these. They do sound a bit rich in bass and have brighter treble but I'm okay with that. I was able to use the default medium plugs out of the package, and are pretty good at sealing out noise. I have bought many of Panasonic's cheaper products including VCR, blu-ray player, rice cooker, and some of their on-ear headphones; they all exceed my expectations for the value. I would certainly consider another pair of these earphones. Heck, they'd even make a great stocking stuffer at this price. Recipient would not be disappointed. All in all, great sound and value with the Panasonic RPHJE120A in-earphone.
summary: I will stick with these unless something better comes along!

reviewText: I bought these headphones for one reason, value.People in my family have a habit of destroying ear buds--cheap and expensive alike. Typically they were lasting 1-4 months. I didn't want to sacrifice audio quality, but with that track record I wasn't ready to spend $30 or even $15 on a pair. With that in mind, I decided to find the best value sub $10 headphones I could find. It was between this model and another brand, which I wont name here, and I happy that I selected this one.If you want a cheap ear bud with great passive noise reduction, this is a great option. They seal they create allows for great audio range that greatly exceeds Apple's ear buds and blocks ambient noise.I bought these and designated them to be only for our iPad, which kept them out of my son's backpack and my wife's purse. They are still going, and are in great shape.The value in these is so great that I don't see any advantage in spending more money on ear buds, unless you are ready to spend over $100 for an entry level audiophile product. Even if there are some $40+ pairs out there that might be a little better (and there are many that are much worse), the quality you would gain for the $30+ is pretty insignificant until you start paying $$$ for very high signal to noise ratio--which is a measure of how "clean" the sound is.
summary: Very satisfied with value of these headphones.

reviewText: I kind of hate earbuds.  Not the concept, but the fact that it's seemingly impossible to find a set that lasts more than a few months.  At ~$6 these are a steal.  They fit well and sound great.  Not sure how long they'll last, but so far I'm very happy.EDIT - update 07/08/13:  just wanted to update.  I've used these pretty much every day for several months and they're still going.  I've had more expensive earbuds that I've babied die on me after 3 months of moderate use.  I wear these Panasonic buds under heavy-duty hearing protection while mowing the lawn (they actually block out more of the mower noise and I don't have to turn my mp3 player up very loud) and while shoveling snow, while exercising, etc.  My first pair of these just keeps going and going.  By far my best set of earbuds yet.

reviewText: For only having paid $11 including shipping, these things are the best value earbuds I've ever owned.The sound quality is actually slightly better than my $100 pair of earbuds that I dropped in water; they have a more pleasant balance between bass and treble. I bought a $30 pair of Sony headphones to replace the old ones but the sound quality was tinny (cymbals always sounded much louder than everything else, too).There has to be a catch, so I'm assuming that these aren't very reliable, considering the price, and guessing they might fail after a few months, but I could buy 9 pairs of them to equal the price of my more expensive pair, which probably wouldn't last as long as 9 pairs of these. Plus, if something happens again and they break due to my negligence, my wallet won't care if I buy a replacement pair.

reviewText: A year or so ago I bought some of theCoby Jammerz High-Performance Isolation Stereo Earphones CVE52BLK (Black)because of the super cheap price, but the sound quality was sometimes noticeably bad and they stopped working randomly about a year later.  While I thought about buying another pair because of how cheap they are, I saw these Panasonic ones with great reviews and a comparable price ($2-$3 more).These are definitely worth the price.  They have a great fit and come with three different sizes of buds to fit any person's ears.  They are slightly angled from the base of the earbud, so for people who don't like that they won't like these.  Overall though, I've experienced great sound quality and comfort with these, much moreso than the Coby Jammerz.

reviewText: I'm a bit of a headphone/earphone snob. I've owned very nice Sennheisers, AKGs and other brand names in the past and present. I own an awesome set of Sony, full-size headphones, which can produce super low bass sound. I've got several pair of JVC, half-size headphones that are great for reproducing a full range of sound and don't look awkward or stupid when you're sitting on the park bench or local bar, listening to your favorite jams from your Smartphone. I also have a pair of awesome, Philips earbud phones of which one set I keep in my motorcycle for listening to NPR or music while riding  case and another in my backpack for general travel use.I wanted to get an inexpensive pair for me and my wife when we are riding our bicycles or walking the neighborhood for exercise. If they were to get lost or damaged, I wouldn't be heart-broken. These produce a pretty good range of sound. They definitely don't have the low-end bass of my Philips earbuds or JVC half-phones, but then they are less than 1/3 the cost of those phones. They can't capture the full range and deep bass of my full-size Sony headphone, but these are less than 1/5 the cost of those. So, for the money, they are a pretty decent value for fairly decent sound. Buy them by the buckets if you have teens, tweens or pre-teens that are always losing their earbud phones.

reviewText: I am an audiophile, but an audiophile who likes to work out and who is very prone to losing cheap headphones. These are exceptional for the amount of money that I paid for them, the bass is slightly boomy or overbearing and is controlled.  The bass has the middle bass hump that you would expect from headphones this inexpensive, but all in all bass is above average in quality for this price range. The midrange is not recessed although it is slightly harsh as midrange is usually the most difficult spectrum for any headphone of any price to reproduce, and these do an admirable job. The highs are decent, but definitely not exceptional and also not harsh at all, which is good. Cons include: an extraordinarily low quality cable, L-jack, and strange nozzle design.

reviewText: I'm not a headphone fanatic so I can't really judge if these provide the best quality of sound, but they certainly meet my expectations and the price + Prime shipping seals the deal. One thing I will note is how well they fit your ear - they employ a curved design to fit well inside your ear and I've never had issues with them falling out like other earbuds. My only other complaint is that they don't have a clamp/"zipper" to bind the two separate cords when not in usage, and as a result they get somewhat tangled every time I put them away.But I really haven't found any better for the price, if you're willing to spend double digits then you might find some with better bass but other than that I thoroughly recommend them.

reviewText: These were bought because of the high ratings here, but I'm not as impressed as some people were.  The sound is reasonable, not the best I've heard from cheap earbuds, but I'm most unhappy with them insofar as the amount of external sound they let in; perhaps they just don't fit my ear well, but--well, I guess they don't.  I've bought cheap JVC earbuds that I liked a lot more than these.I won't buy these again when the die or get lost.UPDATE Mar 2, 2014:  I've had more time to use these earbuds and have modified my opinion of them.  The sound from them seems, to me, to be essentially flat, with no real emphasis on any part of the audio spectrum, which is desirable (for quality sound), or perhaps with a slight boost at the extremes, the bass and treble (perhaps a de-emphasis of the mid range).  The bass is not muddy, the mid's not overpowering (as mid's tend to be in cheap, crummy, earbuds), and the highs are also clean and detailed (keep in mind this is compared to other earbuds I've used, *not* high-end speaker systems and headphones!)  But these fine tonal qualities only present themselves in a quite place.As such, my original complaint stands, insofar as too much outside sound allowed in.  Someone had mentioned that this is due to poor-fitting, but, sorry, that's not the case.  These are great earbuds in a quite environ, but not nearly as good, or useful, in a normal-noise or loud area, i.e., an airplane or some workplaces, like mine.
summary: Not bad, in the right environment

The cable jacket feels like PVC, which I prefer.  I know silicone jackets are more durable, but my Creative earbuds with silicone jackets were very tangle prone.There is a small problem with these earphone and I think it can be fixed, but I haven't had time to do it yet.  The cables enter the buds from the bottom, through a hard plastic tube.  When you move around, the cables hit the tubes and the sound travels through the earbuds.  I think I can fix this issue with some rubber cement or clear caulk.If the color is not important to you, check out all the colors.  The price varies greatly with the color.
summary: Very good for the price, but has some issues

I use the smallest cushions and they fit amazingly well in my ear canal.  My husband has a pair and uses the standard size cushion.The sound quality is fantastic, as well. I would repurchase these if they ever fell apart, though they seem to be very durable.  I would also recommend to friends or family if they were looking for ear buds.  Awesome product!

reviewText: I'm hard on earbuds. I love them. Wear them daily to listen to audiobooks as I putz around the house and go to sleep. (There's something so soothing about being read to sleep!) and these are wonderful. They fit great. They sound even better. I usually go through a pair every few months because I buy the cheapos from wal-mart or best buy and because I mostly use them for audiobooks sound quality isn't a huge deal breaker. These are the best I've encountered and if you factor in how downright NICE the price is? Amazing. They're wonderful. I wish I'd bought more than one pair at a time!Disclaimer: I'm no audiophile. The difference between "horrific" and "okay" sound is noticable but the difference between "okay" and "super flippin nice" is not to my ears. So, if you are one of those people who notice such things, I'm no help. But if you're an average book/music listener looking for nice sounding, cheap costing, and well fitting earbuds? These are a wonderful buy.

reviewText: My Sennheiser earbuds went missing, my Apple earbuds are long gone, so I needed a new pair. Tried using an old, bulky pair of Aiwa Noise Cancelling on ear headphones and the sound wasn't as good, the active noise cancelling worked, but earbuds are nearly as effective.  I don't remember the model number of my Sennheiser, but they sounded great and I had them for a few years. They were $50 new, so they weren't inexpensive. After reading many favorable reviews here and deciding I didn't really want to spend $50 again, I bought these.I am not disappointed. They don't sound as good as the Sennheisers, they aren't nearly as crisp in detail and a bit muddy, especially on older recordings played on an iPod Touch 1G. But for under $10, they are fine and are probably much better than the no-name earbuds I was considering from a discount store. I've always had good luck with Panasonic brand items.True audiophiles will want to look elsewhere, but if you need decent sound for a  price that won't cause you to worry about losing them or breaking them, these are for you. I found them comfortable to wear, personally, on the smallest earpiece.
summary: Great value, good sound for the money

reviewText: These by far are the best headphones I have ever had. The sound quality if great, obviously not top of the line but it gets the job done well. Usually headphones only last me about a year before something goes wrong. One side goes out or the cable needs to be help a certain way for the sound to work. I have had 3 different DRE beats headphones and many other skullycandy, sony, and you name it brands that have all last less than a year.These have laster me over 2 years and the only reason I'm replacing them is because i dropped them outside my house on the street. My girlfriend found them later that day and they had some damage, as if a car ran over one and the sound was a bit low on that side. Amazingly they still work but I'm replacing them because I really don't expect them to last too long with that damage. I wouldn't recommend anyone run over their headphones but WOW can't believe how good the build quality is.The only thing I don't like is that it has no volume control on the wire. I would gladly pay a little more for a future model that includes this. If you go through headphones like I do then look no further. THESE ARE FOR YOU!

reviewText: In my never ending quest to find a reasonably priced headset that has good sound, I gave these a try. The best compliment I can pay these is to say that at least it did not cost me that much money to be disappointed. Uncomfortable (of course, I find most in-ear headphones uncomfortable until I replace the cheapo silicone cushions with foam), and with poor (IMHO) sound quality. I am older, and my hearing is not what it used to be, but... I did expect that these -in-ear headphones would provide adequate amplification. They did not, and the sound they did produce was what I could only describe as tinny.

reviewText: I purchased these after a positive review by a cnet editor, who claimed they are cheap and deliver good sound. But alas...These headphones are a last resort, in-the-pinch sort. I won't give them one star since they work (i.e. deliver sound). But the sound is very tinny and distorts very easily if the music volume is at or above street-listening level (as opposed to library-listening level), as well as if your EQ is set to deliver any small amount of bass. Another thing I didn't like: when you move your head while wearing these, or if the very thin cords move against your clothing (e.g. walking or jogging), the cord rattling sound is very loudly transferred to your ears; so much so that it was very distracting.I'm not picky about style so the minimalist design of these Panasonics suits me fine. Another plus for me is that the cord splits and two equal lengths lead to each ear piece, as opposed to a short cord for one side and a longer cord for the other side after the split. But these are very minor pluses. This Panasonic line offers great selection in colors and unbeatable prices. The set comes with three sizes of comfortable ear fittings.Despite the few redemptive qualities, these headphones lack what I consider the most important attribute of any headphones; good sound quality.
summary: Cheap--you get what you pay for.

reviewText: I think my opinion on these headphones are about a mixture of the Most Helpful Favorable and Critical Review. On one side of the fence these things are pretty darn good for a pair that costs <$10 and as somebody who isn't an audiophile I am very happy with the quality that I get from a pair of in-ear headphones that I won't have to protect like a price Jewel. The bass in these things will leave you shocked by how great they sound in your ear. Now with that being said, I have a pair of $30 Over the Ear Seinheisers that blow these out of the water so the point should be made that if you trying to get quality with a strict budget, you may want to look elsewhere and spend just a bit more money.

reviewText: I've bought several pairs of earbuds hoping to find great bass in an inexpensive earbud, but I've been disappointed every time. These earbuds are no exception. They certainly have good, accurate treble, and *maybe* at a volume high enough to damage your ears they would have good bass (I wouldn't know), but they don't meet my requirement for a good workout earbud with a strong (but accurate) bass. I own the Thinksound ts01 and the V-MODA Vibe and both of these buds have a much superior bass even at a moderate volume. I paid a lot more for them than the current price here on Amazon (as of today) too.
summary: Inadequate bass - get Thinksound ts01 or V-MODA Vibe instead

reviewText: These are great earbuds with a decent sound for the price.  Definitely has good bass and clear treble for the most part. In order to hear the bass stick those suckers deep in your ears, but not too deep, sont want to get hurt haha.

reviewText: These are much better than the normal earphones included with most MP3 players and at this price point are a good set of phones to have around as a spare set.  You won't shed any tears if you break or lose these.  They provide an adequate sound for most types of music.  If you want a fantastic set of earphones, then these aren't the ones you want, but if you're looking for a pretty good pair at a very low price, then grab these.
